author: Neil Shaw
title: Devon man sobs on national radio as he apologises for voting Leave - Devon Live
text:
Devon man sobs on national radio as he apologises for voting Leave "What have I done to my country? I'm so sorry." Share Neil Shaw Head of Digital, live and trending for PlymouthLive, DevonLive and CornwallLive 13:30, 16 NOV 2018
A Devon man has broken down in tears and issued a hearfelt apology on national radio after revealing he voted for Brexit - and now deeply regrets it.
The man, introduced on LBC's James O'Brien call-in as Bill from Exmouth, cried after apologising and saying: "What have I done to my country? I'm so sorry."
Speaking to James, Bill said: "I owe you an apology my dear fellow. I was wrong. I was wrong. I was wrong. I was wrong."
Sobbing, he added: "For some reason I thought we were better off and clearly I was wrong." Read More Theresa May's Brexit withdrawal agreement simplified
Breaking down as the host comforted him, Bill repeated: "I was wrong, I am so sorry. What have I done to my country. I'm so sorry."
James revealed Bill had called the show before where the two of them had spoken about Brexit - James is a remainer.
Comforting Bill, James said: "Bill, there's 17.4million people. You can't take all the blame on your own shoulders.
"Look at the effort. These people are billionaires. They own The Ritz, they own the Daily Telegraph.
"They wouldn't have spent all that money and put all that effort into trying to act against your own interests if they didn't think it was plausible. Read More Devon MP calls for Theresa May to quit as Brexit deal meltdown continues
"I'm not going to let you blame yourself, Bill. No.
"Blame them, Bill, blame them. Do not blame yourself. Don't be sorry, be angry. And if you're not angry yet, I'll be angry on your behalf.
"That right there is why I've been doing what I've been doing for the last two and a half years." Like us on Facebook
